steps: Navigate to Settings > Leave > Leave Policies
Enable Leave Salary Settings by toggling the option in the leave policy
Create a new leave salary policy in Payroll Settings under 'Leave Salary Policy'
Define policy name and description
Select applicable leave types
Configure leave salary calculation formula and select allowance components
Add eligible employees manually to the policy, applying probation restrictions if needed
Review and save the policy
what_to_do.expected_outcome: Leave salary policy is configured with correct parameters, eligible employees assigned, and policy is active from the activation date.

steps: Navigate to Finance > Leave Salary
Review pending leave salary requests and check eligibility
Approve or reject requests
Optionally overwrite approved amounts before final approval
Add approved amounts to payroll table
Process leave salary transactions
what_to_do.expected_outcome: Leave salary requests are reviewed, approved or rejected correctly, and amounts are accurately reflected in payroll.

steps: Determine leave period and choose salary payment month
Calculate prorated salary applying working day settings and excluding non-applicable allowances
Filter employees by 'leave salary' status
Update payroll table with leave salary transactions
Add transaction remarks if needed
Generate Variable Pay File (VPF)
what_to_do.expected_outcome: Leave salary transactions are processed accurately with prorated calculations and integrated into payroll.

what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The report lacks flexible sorting, precise number formatting, and comprehensive employee data fields. It is generated on-the-go, restricting real-time customization and immediate client-requested modifications.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Currency label mismatch on Leave Salary landing page
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The landing page currency label is static and does not adapt to the company's configured currency, causing potential user confusion.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Leave Salary policy assignment timing affects eligibility
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The system does not support retroactive leave salary policy assignments; eligibility is determined at the time of leave request creation.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Multiple leave salary requests for leaves spanning multiple cycles
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The system cannot consolidate or link leave salary requests split across different leave cycles, requiring manual tracking and approvals.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Lack of month-specific granularity in leave salary breakdown
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The platform only shows aggregate leave salary calculations without detailed day allocations per month for multi-month leaves.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Inconsistent leave salary report downloads for individual staff
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Users cannot directly download leave salary reports for specific staff members via the standard interface; manual workarounds are needed.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Complexity and lack of clarity in Leave Salary Encashment configuration
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Users lack clear guidance on salary components, leave status, and working restrictions during encashment periods, leading to misconfigurations.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Incomplete payroll templates missing critical leave data points
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Payroll templates lack granular reporting of absent days and leave salary policy amounts, limiting comprehensive payroll validation.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Inconsistent synchronization between leave approval and payroll salary generation
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Not all approved leave requests propagate automatically to the leave salary queue, causing incomplete payroll processing.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: No automated notification for payroll managers on new leave salary-enabled policies
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Payroll managers must manually track new Time Off Policies with leave salary enabled due to lack of automated alerts.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Lack of comprehensive end-to-end testing for leave salary request generation
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: There is no full e2e test coverage for leave salary request workflows, indicating a testing infrastructure gap.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Missing technical documentation for leave salary calculations
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The platform lacks detailed documentation explaining leave salary calculation rules and processes.
Users cannot filter payroll data by leave salary status, limiting reporting customization.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: User confusion about leave salary transaction posting workflow
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The system lacks intuitive guidance for posting leave salary transactions despite existing filtering functionality.
